column4: Hey all. I decided to check out the service running on my machine and decided that I didn't need "apmd" running. I uncheck the box and then figured that my battery status wasn't displaying right. I enabled the service but it still doesn't work. It says "Can't access ACPI events in /var/run/acpid.socket! Make sure the ACPI subsystem is working and the acpid daemon is running. Any ideas on what to do?
start the acpid daemon, if it isn't running
acpid: can't open /proc/acpi/event: Device or resource busy
something is running that has the pipe tried up.  lsof may tell you what
try strace of the process that produces that error
yes.  use -o to save the results, which will be verbose.  then search the result for the /proc/whatever that it's complaining about
I ran ""strace sudo /etc/init.d/acpid start > somefile 2>&1""  (without the quotes) however there is nothing that has "proc" in that file "somefile"
where's the hour glass damn it?
I also disabled my database service....there wouldn't be a sick connection between databases and apm would there?
I've never seen that.  I have boxes without database servers running apm
